direction.raw_text: th at 11.13.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby girl, born December 24th at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .14. 7   EXT. TRAFALGAR HOSPITAL. LABOR WARD - MORNING                 7 Anna leaves the labor ward, putting on her crash helmet. She emerges out into the crisp, sunny morning. Aziz hurries to catch her up and hands her a wrapped gift.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merry Christmas, Anna.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, don't be ridiculous. He grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you have to open it in front of me. Aziz smiles as Anna unwraps a pair of leather motorcycling gloves. She looks up at him, expressionless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least pretend. Anna considers the gloves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the whole entire history of my life, I have never felt this special.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision       -    11/12/06                           7. 7   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aziz plants a kiss on his two fingers and presses his fingers against Anna's cheek through the open visor of the helmet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wear them.       It's cold. 8   EXT. LONDON STREET - DAY                                         8 Anna rides her big vintage URAL motorcycle through deserted morning streets. As she rides, we hear Tatiana in V.O.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am so excited this morning. Yesterday a friend came back to our village and he told us all about the places on the map that I look at... Paris, Amsterdam, London. He's been there for real... 9   INT. HELEN'S HOUSE. ANNA'S BEDROOM - DAY                         9 After the bright airiness of the bike ride, we are suddenly in Anna's bedroom where the curtains are drawn. Anna is lying awake on the bed, wearing a dressing gown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...he said the future of everything was already happening in all those places. There is a gentle knock at the door, which opens before Anna can respond. It is ANNA'S MOTHER (HELEN) with a cup of tea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you sleep?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no point us tiptoeing around if you're not even sleeping. Helen puts the tea on the dressing table, then turns to leave without a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mum?       Are you OK? (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                              8. 9    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (contrite) Of course not. It's Christmas. 10   INT.   HELEN'S HOUSE. KITCHEN - DAY                             10 Anna is pouring two glasses of sherry. Helen is peeling potatoes. Anna peers at Helen... and sees tears. They share a moment of stifled emotion. Helen wipes her eyes with her sleeve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the chicken. (pause) The smell of chicken roasting reminds me of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should have done beef, then. They look at each other and giggle. They both have potato peelers in their wet hands, sleeves rolled up, two practical unsentimental women being almost consumed by the same wave of emotion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wouldn't be Christmas without tears in the gravy, would it. We hear a gruff Russian voice calling out from the living room (UNCLE STEPAN).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anna! Anna!    Where did you get this? Anna and Helen roll their eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's your own fault for giving him something to play with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I can't read Russian, can I? Anna drops her peeler and hurries into the living room. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                              9. 10   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HELEN'S HOUSE. LIVING ROOM - DAY                           11 The living room table is laid for dinner. Uncle Stepan is early seventies, Russian. He is reading the tiny diary that Anna found in Tatiana's bag. Anna breezes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you, Uncle Stepan, I found it in the handbag of a girl who died in my ward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you always rob the bodies of the dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, we all do it. It's one of the perks of working in a hospital. Stepan grumbles, accustomed to this teasing. Helen enters carrying a bowl of walnuts and brazil nuts which she places on the table. Pause.   Stepan looks pointedly at Helen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you know that your daughter robs the bodies of the dead? (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                             10. 11   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stepan, is there an address? Stepan lays the diary aside, obstinate and prim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have an uncle who doesn't steal things from the dead. Not even their secrets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, don't go all momentous on us, Stepan. (she straightens the table cloth) Lift your elbows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should put this in her coffin, Anna. Bury her secrets with her bodies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Body.   Singular. Stepan leaves in a huff. Anna picks up the diary and begins to study it. She sees the `Trans-Siberian' business card between the pages.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long will dinner be? Helen looks at Anna, suspecting an attempt to escape. 12   EXT. LONDON STREETS - DAY                                       12 Driving music as we see Anna riding her motorbike through deserted morning streets again. We should begin to sense that this is a kind of release for her. We hear Tatiana in V.O.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I was little, London was like a place in the Bible. I wasn't even sure if it was real. My friend has told me there is a place in London where they pay girls to sing. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                               11. 12   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anna arrives outside the `Trans-Siberian' restaurant. It has a Russian-themed frontage in blue and gold, expensively and recently finished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said if I sang in this restaurant I would make more money in a week than my father made in a year. As Anna pulls up we hear a dog begin to bark. 13   EXT. TRANS-SIBERIAN RESTAURANT. SIDE ENTRANCE - DAY               13 The side door opens to reveal a hard-looking, handsome Russian man (NIKOLAI), who stops to groom his hair back from his face and put on a pair of sunglasses as he emerges into daylight. He steps into a small courtyard, where a fierce Doberman dog is barking and snarling on the end of a chain. Nikolai is followed by KIRILL, who is a little younger, slim and pretty but hard-looking too. Kirill is dressed in a crumpled T-shirt and jeans and looks like he had a heavy night. Nikolai ignores the dog as he walks by but Kirill yells at it and teases it with a whoop and few Russian curses. Nikolai unbolts the gate to the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you pick up Ozim and his bitch of a wife and you bring them back here. He glances back at the restaurant and speaks softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I'll think of an excuse and we can get away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll think of an excuse. Your excuses are like fucking fairy tales. Kirill grins and Nikolai flicks the fob of his car keys. The lights on an expensive black Mercedes glow in response. Kirill notices Anna locking up her bike at the front of the restaurant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who the fuck's that? (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -     11/12/06                             12. 13   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They both see Anna removing her crash helmet and shaking out her hair. She walks towards the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe somebody sent your dad a hooker for Christmas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're so... fucking unbelievably disrespectful. Kirill sees that Nikolai is studying Anna and his grin fades. We sense jealousy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you've got work to do.   Go... Kirill grabs Nikolai's face to distract him, gives him a playful slap, but there is somehow more to it than playfulness. Nikolai gets into his car. Kirill glares at Anna as she approaches the front of the restaurant. 14   EXT. TRANS-SIBERIAN RESTAURANT - DAY                              14 As Nikolai drives away, Anna rings the doorbell beside the front door. There is no reply. She is about to ring again when the door opens. We see SEMYON, a Russian man in his late sixties. He is wiping his hands on a tea towel, dressed in a spotlessly white apron. He has the sparkling piercing eyes of a falcon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. She fumbles in her bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry... I'm a midwife. Anna produces her hospital ID and shows it to Semyon. (CONTINUED) BLUE Revision    -   11/4/06                             13. 14   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with a twinkle) Then unless one of my daughters is keeping something from me, you have the wrong address.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to speak to the Manager. Semyon studies the name on the ID.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Khitrova?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My dad was Russian. Semyon seems suddenly delighted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And his name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ivan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, you are Anna Ivanovna. 15   INT. TRANS-SIBERIAN RESTAURANT - DAY                           15 The tables are set for a huge party. Kirill is now on step ladders, fixing some Christmas decorations. Other relatives are getting the place ready. Semyon hurries through the restaurant, leading Anna by the hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We must hurry. I must stir. Stir, stir or the gravy dies in my hands. Today it is family. Here is my son, Kirill. (he hisses at Kirill) Kirill! The berries are too low, too low. And Roman, more glasses for red! (he claps his hands) Come on! Kirill follows Anna's progress through the restaurant with a glare. (CONTINUED) BLUE Revision   -   11/4/06                           13A. 15   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are three little girls in extravagant party frocks, all holding violins and giggling near to the door that (CONTINUED) BLUE Revision    -   11/4/06                              14. 15   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My angels. You should be practising. You must make the wood cry. Like this, like this... Semyon grabs a violin and plays a three-second burst of sad Russian violin music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see... Semyon hurries on into the kitchen.    Anna smiles, delighted at the eccentric old man. 16   INT. TRANS-SIBERIAN RESTAURANT. KITCHEN - DAY                   16 Inside the kitchen there is an inferno of activity, steam, smoke. Family members, some dressed in their party outfits, others in chefs' uniforms, are standing over steaming pots, laughing, arguing. Children play and yell. You can almost smell Christmas. Anna enters, dazzled by it all, overwhelmed by the contrast to her own lifeless Christmas kitchen. Semyon calls out to everyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come, come, hurry, hurry.    They will be here any moment. (to Anna) Ok, show me this card. Anna reaches into her pocket and produces the `Trans- Siberian' business card she found in Tatiana's bag. Semyon angles his head to look as he stirs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is the old card. From before the renovations. But even so, if she had worked here I would remember the name. Perhaps she ate here once. Try this. Semyon offers Anna a spoonful of his gravy.    She sips it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, that's amazing. My dad made gravy just like that. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                             15. 16   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Semyon shrugs and smiles, his eyes twinkling, then goes back to stirring. He speaks as if unconcerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So did you get a chance to talk to this girl before she died? 17   EXT. TRANS-SIBERIAN RESTAURANT - DAY                            17 Nikolai's black Mercedes pulls up outside the restaurant and parks a few inches from Anna's motorbike. The rear windows are sun shaded so we only see Nikolai in the driver's seat.   He gets out of the car and opens the rear door of the car for an elegantly dressed Turkish lady in her fifties. Nikolai goes to the other rear door. The portly figure of Ozim the barber emerges. As Ozim gets out he gives Nikolai a fifty-pound note. 18   INT. TRANS-SIBERIAN RESTAURANT. KITCHEN - DAY                   18 Two of the little girl violinists are fighting, pulling each other's hair. The third is sobbing, sitting on the floor. A young woman in a party dress is carrying a huge silver bowl of sauce across the kitchen. Anna looks delighted at the noise and energy of the place. Finally Semyon emerges from a cloud of steam with a scrap of paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is an agency that hires casual kitchen staff. Maybe you will have more luck there. But I think they will be closed until New Year. As Anna takes the address, Kirill puts his head around the door and yells through the noise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Papa, Ozim is here. Semyon is alarmed and claps his hand in urgent fashion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten minutes!! (to the rest of the kitchen) Fish, fish, fish! Ten minutes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirill, get him a drink and tell him I am coming. (CONTINUED) WHITE Revision    -   9/12/06                                   16. 18   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Semyon takes a pot from the heat, suddenly flustered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anna, I'm so sorry I couldn't help. It is sad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's OK. I'll probably find out more when I get her diary translated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her diary? There is the tiniest of changes in Semyon's manner.        He lays his heavy pot down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I found her diary in her bag. A pause. Semyon disappears into a billow of steam to put a pan onto the heat then re-emerges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did you not tell me you found a diary? He peers at her for a moment, his eyes hardening a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OK, Anna, this is how it will be. You will bring the diary here and I will translate it for you. Then if we get the names of any relatives I will call them myself. I am something of a... community leader for the Russians here in this unfriendly city. What do you say? Semyon hoists a passing child into his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was going to ask my uncle....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And when you come I will make you some more gravy like your papa used to make and you can try the (MORE) (CONTINUED) BLUE Revision    -   11/4/06                             17. 18   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: fish with the sauce. OK? Tomorrow, yes? Shall we say seven? Anna is a little overwhelmed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then it is settled. But for now, you must forgive me. Semyon shrugs then kisses Anna on both cheeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dosvedania. (Goodbye)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dosvedania. Anna heads for the door that leads back to the restaurant. Semyon goes back to stirring but as he stirs he calls out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Anna, you always work at the Trafalgar hospital?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, always. A pause before Anna leaves Semyon to his clouds of steam. 19   INT. TRANS-SIBERIAN RESTAURANT - DAY                           19 Kirill and Ozim are talking confidentially in a mix of Russian and Turkish whispers at a table. Ozim's wife is at a table alone, well out of their earshot, smoking a cigarette and peeling glazed figs. As Anna walks by, Ozim and Kirill stop talking. The scene has a much darker mood to the bustling scene in the kitchen, but for now Anna feels no unease. As she passes, Kirill surveys her with a deadly smile and a professional eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you OK?     You want a drink?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, thanks.     I'm driving. As Anna smiles, Ozim mumbles something in Turkish and Kirill shushes him. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision      -   11/12/06                              18. 19   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .     Merry Christmas.   Drive safely. Ozim giggles.      Anna departs. 20   EXT. TRANS-SIBERIAN RESTAURANT - DAY                               20 Anna emerges into the daylight. As she does she sees that four expensive-looking cars have already parked and various ostentatiously dressed Russian and Turkish couples with their children are emerging from their cars. The women are all wearing furs, even the little girls. The men wear leather or dark suits. They greet each other exuberantly as they emerge from their cars. Anna suddenly feels slightly uneasy. As she approaches her motorbike she sees Nikolai leaning against the bonnet of his car, smoking, still wearing shades. His bumper is almost touching Anna's bike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice bike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice bike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ural. You don't see them anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was my dad's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much do you want for it? Anna has already taken a dislike to this man. He is arrogant and looks potentially violent. His shades, suit and tattoos say it all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It has sentimental value. Nikolai rolls the concept around in his mind and considers. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                             18A. 20   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: `Sentimental value'.   I've heard of that. Anna puts her helmet on. (CONTINUED) BLUE Revision    -   11/4/06                             19. 20   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not staying for the party?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nor me. Chauffeurs don't get invited. You want to go for a drink instead? Anna mounts her bike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Christmas. Everything's closed. Nikolai smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes if things are closed you just open them up, you know? Anna now feels intimidated and luckily the bike fires first time. She rides away. Nikolai watches her go and then stubs his cigarette. 21   INT. HELEN'S HOUSE. DINING ROOM - NIGHT                        21 Sudden silence... perhaps the ticking of a clock. This is Anna's Christmas dinner, a total contrast to the chaos of the restaurant. Stepan is attempting to carve the chicken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anna, how come is it that your boyfriend isn't here to carve? Stepan takes a large sip of vodka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't live with Oliver any more, Uncle Stepan. I'm living back here for a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softly) For as long as you want.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew he would run away from you. (CONTINUED) BLUE Revision    -   11/4/06                              20. 21   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He didn't run away. You make me sound like a burning building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Black men always run away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Stepan!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?   I am allowed to be honest?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was a doctor, Stepan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell has that got to do with it? A pause.     Stepan sips his vodka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is not natural to mix race and race. That is why your baby died inside you. Anna slams her napkin onto the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stepan, shut up! (Anna gets to her feet) Please Anna. Helen takes Anna's hand but she turns and leaves. Helen stands to follow her, but first she whips Stepan's vodka away from him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're just how he was. Stupid bloody drunken Russians. 22   EXT. HELEN'S HOUSE. GARDEN - NIGHT                              22 The garden is just outside the kitchen. Anna is lighting a cigarette. Helen steps outside and reacts to the cigarette. She is about to admonish Anna for smoking, but Anna speaks first. (CONTINUED) WHITE Revision    -   9/12/06                               21. 22   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Christmas. I'm thirty-one. A pause.     Anna blows smoke, clearly upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anna, you know what he's like.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't give a damn about Stepan. Who has that poor baby got in the whole world? Helen reacts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew this would happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Fine.     So you know everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anna, she isn't your responsibility.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The baby is my responsibility until I hand her over to the mother. The mother is dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then it's up to the proper authorities. Anna smiles as if in agreement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The proper authorities will all be skiing until after New Year. Anna coughs a little then stubs her cigarette.        Helen takes the butt as if it were poisonous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's part of the grieving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What grieving? Helen touches her hand.      An inadequate gesture. (CONTINUED) GOLDENROD Revision   -   11/27/06                       22. 22    CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the last year you've lost your father and you lost a baby. Anna is irritated but doesn't put words to her feelings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in and have your dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not hungry. Anna and Helen look into each other's eyes for a moment before Helen heads for the kitchen, carrying the cigarette butt as if it were a deadly snake. 22A   INT. TRAFALGAR HOSPITAL. S.C.B.U. CHRISTINE'S PRIVATE ROOM -22A NIGHT In a private room in the Special Care Baby Unit, Anna approaches Tatiana's baby's plastic crib. The baby is tightly bundled up, sound asleep. Through the windows of the room, we see the darkened, quiet ward outside - another world. Anna stands over the baby, her face full of emotion. There we see pain, loss, shame, emptiness, isolation. Tears begin to roll from her eyes, and then she is sobbing soundlessly. 23    INT. TRANS-SIBERIAN RESTAURANT - NIGHT                        23 The Trans-Siberian restaurant is smoky with cigarettes and cigars. The party is in full swing with two dozen guests and family. One of the golden-haired children is playing violin badly. The language is Russian, English and Turkish mixed. Kirill is bringing a huge baked carp to the table. His mobile phone rings and he wipes his hands on a towel to answer it. When he hears the voice, Kirill glances at his father and moves quickly out of earshot. Semyon notices but hides his concern. As Kirill walks, a child tugs his leg and holds up a soft toy, asking a question in Russian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's called Goofy... Goofy yeah. (into phone) So the coast is clear, yeah? What? I said `coast'. (MORE) (CONTINUED) GOLDENROD Revision    -   11/27/06                       22A. 23   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pause) No, not the beach. It's an English expression, you fucking baboon. I mean... (hissing out of ear shot) ...there are no police. You sure? Good. Kirill glances over at Semyon, who is apparently lost amongst a sea of children, but we see from the corner of his eye he is watching Kirill. (CONTINUED) GREEN Revision   -   11/24/06                            23. 23   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to phone) No, my dad's not involved. I'm a big boy now. I do my own stuff. Yeah. Merry Christmas. Kirill cuts the call and nods to Ozim, who stubs his cigar. Semyon notices their silent communication, then turns to one of the violin-playing angels, smiles, and kisses her on both cheeks. 24   OMITTED                                                        24 25   EXT. OZIM'S BARBER SHOP - NIGHT                                25 We see the car pull up sharply outside Ozim's barber's shop. Nikolai jumps out and opens the door for Ozim. 26   OMITTED                                                        26 The three men walk to the door beside the barber shop. Ozim takes a bunch of keys out and prepares to open the door to the upstairs. He stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The driver stays down here. Kirill smiles and shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really think I do this kind of thing? Kirill puts his hand on Nikolai's shoulder
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This guy's not a driver. He's an undertaker. Ozim looks at Nikolai, highly dubious. BLUE Revision   -   11/4/06                               24. 27   INT. OZIM'S BARBER SHOP. UPSTAIRS ROOMS - NIGHT                 27 The rooms above Ozim's shop have been converted into a drinking club. Ozim leads Nikolai and Kirill through the debris of the night before. As they walk through, Ekrem suddenly leaps out of the darkness with a yell. Kirill and Nikolai both react with instinctive aggression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, hey, hey Ekrem, sakim, durgun, durgun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got tickets, Ozim. It's with Chelsea. They said there was no tickets but I got tickets for the Chelsea game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    You go and watch a
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: leads to the kitchen. Semyon stops when he reaches them and puts his hands on his hips.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: yeah? Ekrem nods and hugs Ozim. We realize he is slightly deranged. Finally he lets Ozim go and leaves. Kirill watches him go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He knows to say he hasn't seen us, right Ozim? Ozim finds the key to the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He don't know anything.    He's touched by the angels. Ozim opens the kitchen door. 28   INT. OZIM'S BARBER SHOP. KITCHEN - NIGHT                        28 Inside the kitchen there are carcasses of lambs hanging from meat hooks. There are knives and skewers around the place. Ozim stops and locks the kitchen door behind them. 29   INT. OZIM'S BARBER SHOP. KITCHEN - NIGHT                        29 The freezer door opens and Ozim gestures towards a large package bound up in black bin liners which are dusted with frost. Kirill nods to Nikolai who grabs the package and hauls it out onto the kitchen floor. Kirill tears a hole in the bin liner and we see the frost-dusted face of Soyka. (CONTINUED) BLUE Revision     -   11/4/06                                 25. 29   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirill studies the face and nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's him. Kirill crosses himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was a time when he was like a brother to me. He puts his hand on his heart with mock solemnity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now he looks like a fucking ice cream. Kirill giggles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, hey, show some respect for a dead man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Respect?   This is respect. Kirill reaches into his pocket and produces an envelope which he hands to Ozim. As Ozim opens the envelope and begins to count the huge wad of cash, Kirill turns to Nikolai.
direction.name: direction

KITCHEN - NIGHT                            30 We cut close to an ancient-looking hair dryer from the shop downstairs being trained onto a human hand with a large eagle tattoo. We pull wide to reveal the full, gruesome scene. (CONTINUED) WHITE Revision    -   9/12/06                            26. 30   CONTINUED:

direction.raw_text: Nikolai has the body of Soyka laid out on a surface, his head still bound up in a bin bag, his lower portions bound up similarly. Nikolai is de-frosting Soyka's left hand with the hair dryer, concentrating on his ring finger which has a gold ring on it. The parts of Soyka's shirt and jacket which are visible are crusted with frozen blood. Nikolai is wearing rubber gloves. As he dries, Nikolai takes a sip of coffee. Ozim is watching this scene with horror. Kirill has his arms folded, mightily impressed. Finally the hand is thawed enough for Nikolai to remove the gold ring. He studies an inscription and then offers it to Ozim. Ozim shakes his head as if the thing were a contagion. Nikolai shrugs and pockets it. He then turns the hair dryer back on and blows some hot air onto the crisply bloody chest of Soyka. He tugs at the frozen lapel of the jacket and blows air into the inside pocket. Within a few moments he is able to remove Soyka's glistening, thawing wallet which is caked in frozen blood. He opens it (we glimpse a photo of a wife and children) and blows hot air onto the money inside. He tugs a wad of frozen bank notes from the wallet, all stuck together by drops of frozen blood. He offers this money to Ozim as well but Ozim shakes his head vigorously. Kirill hoots with laughter. Ozim is now staring at Nikolai as if he were a devil from hell. Nikolai grabs a plastic bag and puts the money inside it, then pockets the frozen wad. He tosses the rest of the frozen wallet to Ozim, who instinctively catches it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd better burn that. Ozim, reacting to the cold of the wallet and to the horror of it, drops the thing on the floor. Nikolai looks at Ozim as if he were a complete amateur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you finish cutting his hair? Ozim can't answer.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you want to dump a body, this is the place. The currents keep it under the surface until past the barrier. Semyon is back at his novel and watches as Kirill attempts to get to his feet and then stumbles to the floor. He slumps down, now totally unconscious, breathing deeply. Nikolai smiles.

direction.raw_text: We went to a Kurdish place. They don't even celebrate Christmas. Semyon steps up to where Kirill is lying and stands over him for a moment. direction.name: direction

Inside the tent two senior police officers await the arrival of a third man, a specialist from the Russian desk (YURI), who is not dressed for the weather. He has obviously been dragged out of bed. direction.raw_text: He is actually a Chechen. He is also a member of the vory v zakone. The stars on the knees mean he would never kneel before anyone. Yuri opens the dead man's shirt and we see a tattoo of an eight-pointed star on his chest.

direction.raw_text: In Russian prisons, your life story is written on your body in tattoos. You don't exist without tattoos. (pause) He was a captain. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision   -   11/12/06                          37A. 40A   CONTINUED:

Their eyes are sunken and their faces vacant of expression, but they are painted with so much make-up they almost look like tiny, sad clowns. They sit in silence as the music blares out. direction.raw_text: Yeah? Nikolai glares at Kirill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well if my examination is over, get the fuck out of here while I get dressed. Kirill grins and offers the girl an elaborate bow before leaving. Finally alone, Nikolai gently helps the girl to lie down. She is numb. He covers her up with a blanket then begins to pull on his clothes. The girl is staring up at the ceiling. After a few moments she begins to sing a Russian folk song softly under her breath. Nikolai speaks to her softly in Russian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in Russian) What's your last name? A pause. Finally the girl stops singing but is silent. Nikolai is insistent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in Russian) Tell me your last name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirilenko. (CONTINUED) GOLDENROD Revision      -   11/27/06                        45. 45   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in Russian) Where are you from? Silence. She looks up and stares into Nikolai's eyes. She sees some urgency there...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ukraine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where? Which village? Which town?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Irpen. Outside Kiev. The girl is asking a silent question but Nikolai doesn't linger. He heads for the door then stops and turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay alive a little longer. 46   INT. TRAFALGAR HOSPITAL. S.C.B.U. CHRISTINE'S PRIVATE ROOM -46 NIGHT In the half-lit private room, Anna is dancing with Christine in her arms. She is singing a lullaby softly to her. The door is open to the rest of the ward and all the other babies are silent. Finally she lays a sleeping Christine back in her crib. She sits down on the bed where the mother should be. She curses herself silently and gets to her feet, determined to pull herself together. As she starts to leave the private room to enter the ward, she is suddenly confronted by Semyon. He is standing in the shadows, a Bavarian trilby in his hands. Anna gasps with shock. Semyon speaks softly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello Anna.     I came on tiptoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you get in here? (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                            45A. 46   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are always open doors, Anna Ivanovna. (CONTINUED) WHITE Revision   -   9/12/06                                46. 46   CONTINUED: (2)                                                    46 Anna glances at an alarm button.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not allowed in here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please Anna, let me speak. Semyon looks to be almost in tears.     He speaks softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I translated the diary... A baby begins to cry and is comforted somewhere across the ward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was shocked to discover... that my son Kirill is mentioned many times. Semyon appears to be fighting tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have known for some years that he has strayed from the path I set out for him. His mother died when he was very young. A pause.   Anna almost begins to buy his sorrow...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does it say about him? Semyon looks up, his eyes filled with tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Many bad things. A pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Anna please. Let me deal with him. If the diary should find its way to the police... Semyon wipes his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of the things my son did are illegal. Anna, he is a good boy. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                             47. 46   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care about him.   I care about the baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course.   Of course. And that is the baby? Semyon glances over Anna's shoulder into the corner where Christine is sleeping. Anna freezes and doesn't reply. Semyon takes her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anna, I have made some inquiries and I have found out an address for Tatiana's family in Russia. That's where the baby belongs, no? Anna reacts but Semyon's face suddenly hardens...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So... perhaps we can do a deal. He stares into her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you understand me, Anna? At that moment a nurse walks by and hesitates when she sees Semyon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anna?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's OK.   He's just leaving. Semyon puts his hat onto his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know where I am, Anna Ivanovna. He turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I know where you are. Semyon disappears into the shadows of the ward.     As Anna reacts we hear Tatiana in V.O. (CONTINUED) WHITE Revision   -   9/12/06                            48. 46   CONTINUED: (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was thrown down the stairs and fell onto some sacks, like potato sacks... 47   INT. HELEN'S HOUSE. KITCHEN - DAY                              47 Stepan is sitting at the kitchen table, translating Tatiana's diary aloud, as Helen transcribes it onto a note pad. Stepan's translation breaks up with emotion but he tries to remain detached. Helen also tries hard to concentrate on her task but wipes away a tear as she writes. Tatiana's V.O. slowly blends into Stepan's voice...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...like potato sacks. Kirill came down after me and he hit me until I was bleeding. Then he tried to rape me but he couldn't do it... He just got madder and madder and kept hitting me. In the end his father came down. It was the father who raped me. He shouted at his son...'if you don't break a horse, it will never be tame, Kirill'. They hear a key in the door and prepare for Anna's arrival. When she enters she feels the tense silence. After a moment, Helen tries to be bright...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello dear. How was your night? Anna sees the tears in both their eyes.   She sees the diary and the transcription and sits down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stepan's arthritis is playing up. I'm taking dictation. Helen gets to her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like some tea or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Anna gently pushes Helen back into her seat. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                              49. 47   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He came to see me. Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man from the restaurant.    He came to the hospital. Stepan leaps to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you this would happen!    I told you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit down Stepan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The devil is loose now. Everyone begins to talk at once...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know it's my fault...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's no one's fault...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are in this room now.   They are cancer...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should just sit down calmly and think...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a friend from Ukraine who owns a gun....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stepan!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...from the war in Afghanistan. (CONTINUED) WHITE Revision     -   9/12/06                            50. 47   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't talk about guns... Anna suddenly stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up both of you!!! Silence.   Everyone catches their breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OK... now... what would dad have done? A pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We all know what he would have done. Stepan heads for the kitchen cupboard and produces a bottle of vodka. Rather than admonish him, Anna and Helen both nod agreement. Stepan pours three large vodkas. Stepan knocks his down. Anna and Helen take sips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then he would have been practical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He would ask if there were bullets for the gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! This isn't our world.     We're just... ordinary people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dealt with the vory v zakone when I worked for the KGB.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You never worked for the fucking
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Semyon doesn't blink. At that moment a little girl of seven (MARIA) emerges from the darkness, carrying a soft toy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Anna!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was an auxiliary! (CONTINUED) WHITE Revision    -   9/12/06                              51. 47   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please! A stand off.     Finally...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did this man want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The diary. In return he'll give us an address for Tatiana's family. For Christine's family. A pause.   They all look to each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's all he wants? Stepan is utterly astounded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You cannot do deals with these people!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't a deal.      It's an exchange of information.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you forgotten already what I just read to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We must be practical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stepan, I think he was threatening to harm Christine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then it's settled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!!    No!!   No!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stepan, this isn't our world.      We are ordinary people. (CONTINUED) BLUE Revision    -   11/4/06                              52. 47   CONTINUED: (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was an ordinary person. He leaves. Anna and Helen hold hands, genuinely close now for the first time in a long time. 48   EXT. TRANS-SIBERIAN RESTAURANT - NEXT DAY                       48 Nikolai pulls up in his car. He checks his look in the rear view mirror and puts on his sunglasses. As he gets out of the car he notices that Anna's motorbike is still there. He approaches it, strokes the bodywork. Suddenly, someone grabs him from behind. It's Kirill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, come on, Nikolai, I've got a Christmas present for you. 49   EXT. TRANS-SIBERIAN RESTAURANT. BACK DELIVERY AREA - DAY        49 A white van is parked with its rear doors open, ready for unloading. Kirill shows Nikolai that the van is loaded with unmarked white boxes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open one. Nikolai opens one of the boxes and produces a bottle of vintage champagne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From France. Old as fuck. Old is good with wine. Sixty quid a bottle anywhere. Except I got them for ten quid a case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: `From where?' From where you don't ask. Give it here... Kirill snatches the bottle and begins to uncork it. (CONTINUED) WHITE Revision    -   9/12/06                             53. 49   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If my dad says OK, I can start telling you about the serious stuff. Import, export. This booze is just for gifts to Papa's friends. The real import stuff is from Kabul, you understand? He pops the cork and swigs the frothing champagne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Import-export sounds good. Kirill laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bet it's fucking good... Nikolai hands the bottle back. As he does, one of the van doors is kicked closed revealing Semyon, suddenly upon them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ, Papa... You scared me.... Semyon grabs the bottle of champagne and smashes it on the floor. Kirill recoils in terror. Nikolai straightens, faces up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong? We're just sampling it! Semyon is so furious he still can't speak. He grabs Kirill and slams him against the wall. Finally he hisses in his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your friend Soyka is dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? So what? What's that got to do with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't lie to me!! Semyon slams Kirill against the wall once more. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                                54. 49   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I swear I don't know nothing about it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said, don't lie to me! Semyon slams Kirill hard against the wall again.       Suddenly Nikolai steps forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your dad is right, Kirill.       There's no point lying to him. A pause. Semyon and Kirill are frozen for a moment. Nikolai calmly lights a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ozim's nephew slit Soyka's throat. Kirill paid him to do it. There is stunned silence.       Semyon loosens his grip on Kirill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in Russian) Shut your fucking mouth!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in Russian) Your dad always knows the truth anyway. Nikolai and Semyon survey each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's OK boss. You don't have to worry...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (incredulous) I don't have to worry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I disposed of the body myself. The police won't find a thing. Semyon has now lost all interest in Kirill and is concentrating on Nikolai. He laughs with incredulity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My son commits a murder? (MORE) (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                          55. 49   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On my own doorstep? A fellow soldier! And no one thought to tell me about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The vory code says you don't talk to anybody about your captain. Kirill is my captain. Semyon circles Nikolai.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I found out what had happened, I did what I had to do to clean the situation up. Kirill is about to speak but before he can, Nikolai speaks for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a matter of honor. Soyka was spreading lies about Kirill. About your family. (in Russian) Kirill did the right thing. Semyon hisses with fury and grabs Nikolai.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I decide what is right and what is wrong. You do not kill a vor for no reason. Nikolai shrugs Semyon off, holding his ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know as well as I do Soyka was talking to the police. A pause. Semyon is shocked at the depth of Nikolai's knowledge. He peers at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a driver, you are well informed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got connections with the Chechens who export cars. Soyka was speaking to the Russian desk. Scotland Yard. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                            56. 49   CONTINUED: (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirill did a good thing for all our people. Our people will know that. In Semyon's silence Kirill finally gathers courage...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Papa, I swear to you, I was going to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up! Kirill is hurt that Semyon seems only to be interested in Nikolai. After studying Nikolai for a while...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you are so well informed, you will know Soyka has brothers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's OK. Kirill has got me. Semyon shows the first flicker of admiration. He then looks at Kirill with utter contempt, making the comparison with Nikolai obvious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get these boxes out of sight. Semyon leaves them. Kirill is angry, straightening his clothes. Finally he yells....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard him, patsan!   Get these boxes out of sight. 50   INT. BURGER RESTAURANT - DAY                                   50 It is Saturday morning and the place is full of families. Christmas decorations are beginning to look ragged. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                            57. 50   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anna and Helen are sitting at a table, terrified but trying hard to stay calm. Stepan arrives with a tray of coffees and a burger. He sits, and Anna and Helen glance uneasily at each other. Stepan begins to eat noisily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How the hell can you eat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm hungry. There is a tension that builds until Nikolai's Mercedes suddenly looms into view, filling the street window of the burger bar. Nikolai gets out of his car, all shades and sharp suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's their driver. Stepan very deliberately slides his hand into his inside pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me you haven't done anything ridiculous... Stepan removes his hand, empty, his bravado crushed. Nikolai enters the restaurant and spots Anna. He comes and sits at the table beside Stepan, opposite Anna. It's a tight squeeze. Anna and Helen are stiff with terror. Nikolai smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meet in a public place with lots of people around. Very wise. He smiles at Helen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I see you brought along a body guard. Also very wise. Stepan is shaking with emotion and hisses something in Russian. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                              58. 50   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispers, in Russian) When I was in the KGB, we knew how to deal with scum like you. Nikolai smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in Russian) When you were in what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shush, Stepan. Anna? Nikolai is amused by the three of them. Anna produces Tatiana's diary and hands it to Nikolai. Nikolai studies it and nods. He gets to his feet...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shaking) Now you give me the address.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What address?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tatiana's family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you're talking about. Nikolai calmly heads for the door.      Stepan hisses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you!       I knew they would do this.... Anna gets to her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anna!      No!   Come back here! Anna races out of the restaurant in pursuit of Nikolai. 51   EXT. BURGER RESTAURANT - DAY                                     51 Nikolai has emerged into the busy suburban street and is about to get in to his car. Anna flies at him, yelling. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                              59. 51   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was fourteen! Read the diary! She was fourteen when he raped her! Nikolai casually hits the key fob of his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You murdered her! You bastards murdered her! Passers-by stare at Anna. Helen and Stepan have come out of the restaurant to restrain her. Nikolai stops and judges the fury on Anna's face. He speaks calmly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anger is very dangerous. It makes people do stupid things. Forget any of this ever happened. You're in the wrong place, Anna Ivanovna. He gestures at the burger restaurant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You belong in there. With nice people. Stay away from people like me. Anna and Nikolai are staring at each other, suddenly a strange connection between them. Then Stepan steps forward and spits in Nikolai's face, delivering a Russian curse as he does so. Nikolai almost reacts out of instinct but stops himself. Nikolai wipes his face and peers into Anna's eyes.       Finally he gets into his car and drives away. 52   INT. TRANS-SIBERIAN RESTAURANT - NIGHT                             52 Nikolai is alone, sitting at a candlelit table, reading Tatiana's diary. We hear Tatiana in voice-over...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am not sure I can carry on another day. The windows won't open so I can't throw myself out. They inject me every day with heroin. (MORE) (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                             60. 52   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) Sometimes I think this is all a hallucination... He sees Semyon approaching from the kitchen and closes the diary. Semyon grabs a bottle of vodka from the bar on his way to sit opposite Nikolai. Nikolai pushes the diary across the table. Semyon pours two drinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is good to have someone who I can trust to do simple tasks. A pause as Semyon glances at a few pages of diary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In this business, sometimes the biggest danger comes from the most stupid things. You can't afford to be careless in any area. Nikolai senses a change of attitude towards him. As if Semyon were beginning to accept him into the fold. Semyon raises a toast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nasdrovia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nasdrovia. After a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what was the lie that Soyka was spreading about my son? Nikolai looks anxious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was nothing important.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirill had him killed for nothing important? Semyon pours two more vodkas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to repeat it. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                            61. 52   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For me you will repeat it. Nikolai doesn't respond. It is obvious that Semyon half knows already. He shrugs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You play   with the Prince to do business   with the King. But if you want   to do business with me you must   be open with me. Thieves- in-law. A pause.   Semyon nurses his vodka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was Soyka saying about the Prince? He stares into Nikolai's eyes.    Finally, Nikolai stammers...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That he is a drunk.    And that he is also... a queer. Semyon swigs his vodka and Nikolai swigs his. Semyon pours two more. Semyon has to stare out of the window to hide his emotion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My only son. They both knock their drinks back. Semyon looks suddenly angry as he peers out of the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know it never snows in this City. And it's never hot. London is a city of whores and queers. My son... Semyon shrugs, fighting deeper emotion...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I think London is to blame for what he is... (CONTINUED) WHITE Revision    -   9/12/06                              62. 52   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So why don't you go home? Semyon smiles, as if seeing Moscow through the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cold gets into my bones. A pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And also... the KGB would be waiting for me. Nikolai smiles ruefully and glances at Semyon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   They are called FSB now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever they call them they are worse even than the KGB were. Maybe the KGB and the vory v zakone were partners in a marriage. We had rules, they had rules. He swigs some more vodka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now in Moscow, the thieves don't wear tattoos and the police don't wear uniforms. You never know who they are... Semyon seems to be taking the vodka less well than Nikolai. He pours some more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've heard about these new policemen? Nikolai doesn't blink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They get under you, over you, behind you, inside you. They are the ones you least expect. Semyon peers at Nikolai and Nikolai doesn't respond. Mention of the new breed of FSB agent causes an almost imperceptible tension in Nikolai. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                             63. 52   CONTINUED: (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The midwife said she had an uncle. A Russian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I met him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you know what he looks like. Semyon peers at Nikolai.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She said he has read the diary. A pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't trust a Russian with that kind of information. A pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you understand me? Semyon gets to his feet and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps you can deal with him. Semyon leaves Nikolai to stare into the flames of the burning diary. 53   EXT. TRAFALGAR HOSPITAL. MATERNITY UNIT - DAY                   53 Anna exits, pulling on her coat against the cold. She stops in her tracks when she sees her unchained motorbike parked in the parking bay. She hears Nikolai's voice over her shoulder. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -    11/12/06                                 64. 53   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought I'd bring it back before it got stolen. Lot of villains around. Sorry about the chain. Anna is about to walk quickly away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got that address you wanted. Anna turns and sees Nikolai is offering a scrap of paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little village outside St. Petersburg. I know it. Not much of a place for a kid to grow up in. Especially not a girl. She hesitates.       Nikolai approaches and gives her the address.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you want my opinion, the kid would be better off in London. Maybe with you. Why not? Tatiana's family don't sound like the kind of people who'd want another mouth to feed. A pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You read the diary? Nikolai looks all around.        Anna studies him, unsure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So how can you keep doing what you're doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you.    I'm just a driver. Anna sees some softness in his expression.        Their eyes lock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look the other way. (CONTINUED) WHITE Revision    -   9/12/06                               65. 53   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a camera. The pictures stay in my head. Anna sees pain in his eyes.     She peers at the address.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did you bring me this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I was passing. After a long moment Anna turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, and... your uncle. Nikolai smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it true he was in the KGB?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he's a brave old man.    That's for sure. A pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does he live with you? Anna is about to answer but stops herself. Nikolai peers at her and finally shrugs then turns to walk away. He gestures at the bike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I fixed it.    It should be OK now. Anna watches him walk away into the street. 54   EXT. CHELSEA FOOTBALL GROUND. SIDE STREETS - NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Stepan stares at them both for a long time.   Finally he gets to his feet and points to the diary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is Semyon too drunk to notice? There is a strange game going on here. For now, nothing is revealed. Semyon knocks back his vodka and Nikolai does the same. Semyon picks up the diary and holds it into the flame of the candle. It begins to burn and he drops it into the ashtray. The flames flicker for a while.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Crowds of football supporters are streaming away from the football stadium, where the floodlights are still casting their glow. There are Arsenal and Chelsea supporters on opposite sides of the street and there is some mildly vicious yelling between the two groups. Police are visibly keeping order. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                             66. 54   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Among the crowd we see Ekrem. He seems slightly drunk on top of his normal craziness. He has an Arsenal scarf around his neck and is looking for trouble, jeering at the Chelsea supporters across the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Hey Kabuka Chelsea! Fuck you!! Yeah you! Aliverisme!! Fucker! A policeman steps up to Ekrem and gives him a shove and he stumbles a little. As he gets to his feet we notice TWO CHECHEN MEN who are trailing Ekrem, ducking their heads away from the line of policemen. 55   EXT. CEMETERY - NIGHT                                           55 Ekrem is now isolated from the crowds, swigging from a can of lager. He is chanting `Arsenal, Arsenal' to himself as he walks. He stops to take a piss on someone's grave. In the background the two Chechens are coming closer. As Ekrem zips his flies, the Chechens are upon him. One of them grabs his Arsenal scarf and begins to strangle him. Ekrem chokes for a while and the Chechen loosens the knot. The second Chechen pulls out an open razor. Ekrem struggles to escape...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For my brother... The Chechen cuts Ekrem's throat then drops him onto the grave stone. 56   INT. TRANS-SIBERIAN RESTAURANT - NIGHT                          56 The place has two dozen customers and there is a Russian band playing `Dark Eyes'. At a particular table an old Russian lady is having her birthday celebrated by an adoring family and lots of very ancient friends. There is a huge round of applause as Semyon emerges from the kitchen with a cake decorated with sparklers. 57   INT. TRANS-SIBERIAN RESTAURANT. KITCHEN - NIGHT                 57 Semyon returns to smoke and steam and yelling. As he prepares to take a drink one of the young dishwashers approaches. (CONTINUED) BLUE Revision    -   11/4/06                              67. 57   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in Russian) Guy out the back. Semyon grabs a bottle of vodka. 58   EXT. TRANS-SIBERIAN RESTAURANT. KITCHEN REAR - NIGHT            58 Semyon emerges into the wine crates and beer bottles in the yard at the back of the restaurant where the Doberman is straining at the leash, snarling and barking. An already anxious Ozim is cowering in the shadows, held at bay by the dog. The moment Semyon steps out the dog stops barking. Ozim relaxes a little and steps forward. Semyon pets the dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what did they say? Semyon takes a swig of vodka.    Ozim looks severely nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were going to kill me.   Those Chechens are savages. Ozim is reliving the ordeal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I pointed out that I am a Muslim too and it is a sin for a Muslim to kill a Muslim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did they say about my son?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They said they would spare me only if I delivered Kirill to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are being very honest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I fear you more than I fear them. Semyon suddenly breaks the neck of the bottle and holds the jagged edge to Ozim's throat. The dog snarls at Semyon's feet. (CONTINUED) WHITE Revision    -   9/12/06                             68. 58   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never again do business with any member of my family behind my back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never. I will never listen to Kirill again. I swear... Semyon tosses the bottle away.       After a moment...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do they know where to find Kirill?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are like wolves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do they know what he looks like? Ozim shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. They have just arrived from the mountains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then tell them you will deliver Kirill to them. Ozim is stunned.      He stares at Semyon as if he were insane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell them to give you two days. 59   INT. HELEN'S HOUSE. ANNA'S BEDROOM - NIGHT                        59 Anna is reading the translation of the diary by lamplight. Tatiana's voice over continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know now for sure that I am pregnant. It hasn't begun to show yet. After I was raped they made me take pills but I guess it was too late. I am condemned to give birth to a new life. But first I will try to find a way to end my own life and spare this child the pain. Anna looks up from the pages and thinks. PINK Revision   -   11/12/06                             69. 60   EXT. HOUSING ESTATE - NIGHT                                    60 A large public housing estate is being swept by rain. Christmas lights glow in the windows of the dilapidated tower blocks. Stepan is walking against the wind, carrying a bag of shopping. He holds onto his Russian hat to stop it blowing away. Kids splash in the puddles. Stepan arrives at the front garden of his small, ground- floor council flat. As he fumbles for his keys in the cold we see that Nikolai is watching him from the driver's seat of his Mercedes. Once Stepan has disappeared into his flat, Nikolai gets out of the car and approaches Stepan's flat. 61   INT. HELEN'S HOUSE. KITCHEN - NIGHT                            61 Helen is preparing food for a small family dinner. Anna enters with her cellphone in her hand. She mooches for food to hide her agenda. Finally...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mum... I can't get hold of Stepan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you want to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to check something with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anna...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (matter of fact) He's not at home, do you know where else he might be? Helen simply stares at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anna. Haven't you had enough excitement?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (deadpan) I think I've worked out who Christine's father is. (CONTINUED) BLUE Revision    -   11/4/06                            70. 61   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen slams her knife down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why does it matter?!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It matters... to me!! A pause. After a moment Helen goes to her, holds her hands and peers into her eyes. We expect comforting words, but instead...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You enjoy this. A pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're like your father. Ordinary life isn't enough. Anna turns and walks out of the house. 62   EXT. LONDON STREETS - NIGHT                                   62 Anna drives her motorbike through North London streets. Rain is falling. 63   EXT. TRANS-SIBERIAN RESTAURANT - NIGHT                        63 Anna is standing in the falling rain, staring over at the trans-Siberian restaurant. The restaurant is busy, with the noise of revelers swelling every time the door is opened. Anna seems to be exiled from where she should really be - Inside a restaurant like this, with its danger and vibrancy. Suddenly she is illuminated by headlights. She turns and sees that Nikolai is pulling up in his Mercedes. Kirill is in the passenger seat. Nikolai gets out of the car and stops when he sees Anna. Anna is like a fox caught in headlights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing here? A pause. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                             71. 63   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (echoing Nikolai's words) I don't know. I was passing. Kirill studies the gaze between Nikolai and Anna and senses the connection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're passing, you pass. You keep going, bitch. Nikolai, come on... Kirill grabs Nikolai's arm, and after peering at Anna for a moment, he turns to go with Kirill. Anna gathers her courage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Family is important to you people isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'You people'? (in Russian) What the hell is she talking about? Music swells from the restaurant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell Semyon the baby I delivered on Christmas Eve is his daughter. Kirill and Nikolai stop. A swell of laughter from the restaurant. Anna is about to continue but Nikolai steps forward and places two fingers on Anna's lips to stop her from saying anymore. Anna tears his hands from her mouth. At the same time Kirill yells in Russian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did she say?! Anna is terrified but angry too.    She yells.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When he raped her she was a virgin. Then they gave her pills. Semyon has to be the father! (CONTINUED) WHITE Revision     -   9/12/06                                72. 63   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirill suddenly goes for her over the bonnet of the car....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in Russian)) She's a civilian! Kirill pushes Anna up against the car, but she fights him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was fourteen!      She was a child! Kirill slaps Anna hard.     Nikolai grabs Kirill and pulls him away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't use my father's name! You don't say that filth about him... He goes for Anna again, and this time Nikolai shoves Kirill to the wet ground. He looks up at Nikolai and slowly gets to his feet. He wipes his hands then stares into Nikolai's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't even look at her any more. Headlights from a passing car sweep the scene....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's an order. Nikolai peers at Anna for a moment.     Anna's voice is defiant but cracking with fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him what I said. Nikolai has taken what Anna said on board.        He speaks softly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is nothing to tell.      Slaves give birth to slaves... Kirill yells....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on Nikolai!! He turns to Anna... (CONTINUED) BLUE Revision    -   11/4/06                              73. 63   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if you open your mouth again, I'll tell my driver to stick his cock inside it! Understand? Maybe that's what you want! He offers the lights of the restaurant to her as a vicious invitation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to come in?! Maybe we all get to fuck you.... Anna stares back. Nikolai peers at her for a moment before grabbing Kirill and pulling him away towards the restaurant. 64   INT. TRANS-SIBERIAN RESTAURANT. KITCHEN - NIGHT                 64 The place is winding up. Chefs and waiters are cleaning surfaces and dishes. The only still point is Semyon, who is cutting and wrapping the birthday cake in small parcels of golden paper. He works intensely and delicately at the back of the kitchen. Nikolai and Kirill enter. Kirill swigs a half-drunk glass of wine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That girl you fucked in front of me... you remember her? The Ukrainian bitch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So they kick down the door. These are ordinary fucking police. They ask for her by name and they take her away. Some fucking punter must have given them her name. What gives the police the right to take our women, huh? Semyon shoots Kirill a hard look: he's talking too much and too loudly. Kirill ignores the look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Papa, I never seen so many old people in one place. Whose party is it out there? The angel of death? (CONTINUED) WHITE Revision    -   9/12/06                               74. 64   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in Russian) She is one hundred years old. Semyon works on for a moment then glances at Kirill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirill, go down into the cellar and bring up some brandy. Twelve bottles. Kirill turns to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Nikolai, help me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. He stays here.   I want to talk business. A confused pause.     Kirill looks from Nikolai to his father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What business? A pause as Kirill suddenly senses his exclusion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Papa, what business? His business is my business. Semyon stares at Kirill and Kirill knows the look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go to the cellar Kirill.   And take your time. Kirill hesitates. He is angry as hell but too scared of his father's gaze to say anything. Finally he turns fast and departs, slamming his open hand against the door as he goes. Semyon waits a moment before returning to the business of cutting the cake. Finally...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you deal with the old man? Nikolai nods. A pause.     Semyon looks up and fixes Nikolai with a stare. (CONTINUED) BLUE Revision    -   11/4/06                            75. 64   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in Russian) It's time you joined us. A long moment. The thing Nikolai has been working for has finally happened. There seems to be little joy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in Russian) Thank you. Papa. Semyon returns to his work.    Nikolai hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What shall I tell Kirill? Semyon continues with the cake, unconcerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him I changed my mind about the brandy. 65   INT. TRANS-SIBERIAN RESTAURANT. CELLAR - NIGHT                65 The cellar is half lit, the arched walls lined with crates of wine. Flour, grease and potatoes are stored here. As Nikolai walks down the steps into the gloom, he hears Kirill singing a Russian folk song to himself as he drags a case of brandy across the cellar floor. Kirill has already opened a bottle of brandy and takes a long swig as Nikolai joins him. He grins as he gestures at the brandy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My dad swapped a little Georgian girl for this stuff. Nikolai sits down on a crate, rests his head against the wall. Kirill joins him and swigs some more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, don't feel bad. What happened up there is just how he is. He plays people against each other. That's all. I realize more and more what he's like. Here, drink to the Georgian girl... Kirill offers the bottle to Nikolai but he refuses. (CONTINUED) PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                             76. 65   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?   I drink alone now. Nikolai decides to bite the bullet, get this news over with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He offered me stars. I accepted them. A long pause. This is what Kirill wanted, but now it feels like a stab in the back. Finally Kirill swallows a huge swig of brandy then turns awkwardly to hug Nikolai. He squeezes him hard for a long time then shoves him away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I didn't know already? He told me before. It was my fucking idea. He said there are a lot of things I have to teach you. Nikolai nods.    Kirill gets to his feet....
direction.name: direction
